New Records: It's the first time Ireland have come from behind to win a game since 2012 when they beat Kazakhstan.
Key Match Events: Robbie Brady scored a late winning goal for Ireland.
Liam Scales scored his first goal for Ireland with a header.
Nathan Collins made a mistake leading to Finland's goal by Joel Pohjanpalo.
Robbie Brady provided an assist for Liam Scales' goal.
Festy Ebosele's play led to Robbie Brady's winning goal.
Finland's Kallman nearly scored with a header that went just past the post.
Ireland's goal by Evan Ferguson was disallowed for offside.
Pre-Game Insights: Heimir Hallgrímsson emphasized the importance of confidence and building on training improvements.
Ireland's lineup included Kelleher, O'Shea, Collins, Scales, Brady, Azaz, Cullen, Knight, Ogbene, Ferguson, and Szmodics.
Finland's lineup included Hradecky, Ståhl, Ivanov, Hoskonen, Galvez, Schüller, Walta, Kamara, Lod, Keskinen, and Pohjanpalo.
Post-Match Reflections: Heimir Hallgrímsson expressed satisfaction with the team's performance and confidence boost.
Robbie Brady highlighted the hard work of the team and praised Liam Scales and Festy Ebosele's contributions.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Ireland's win puts them three points behind England in the group.
The match was part of the UEFA Nations League.
